Taxa: Transcription Factor Binding: tf co-factor binding
Reviewer Commments: aka mAM (mouse ATFa-associated Modulator)It colocalizes and interacts with ATFa in mammalian cells, contains a bipartite nuclear localization signal and possesses an ATPase activity. PMID 10777215    atp-ase activity; colocalization with atfa; Y2H interaction with ATFa

In EMSA, NFAT5 binds the IL-2 promoter ARRE-2 sequence. ChIP assay shows NFAT5 binds to regulatory elements of the aldose reductase and TNF-alpha genes. Transfection assays indicate NFAT5 activates TNF transcription.

Taxa: Transcription Factor Binding: tf co-factor binding
Reviewer Commments: SERTAD1 has benn shown to transactivate different promoters synergistically with different TF. It has also been shown to physically interact with different TF. It carries a transactivation domain but doesn't seem to bind directly to DNA.

Taxa: Transcription Factor Binding: tf co-factor binding; DNA-Binding: sequence-specific
Reviewer Commments: Smad9 is part of the Bone morphogenetic protein (BMP) signalling pathway together with other Smad proteins.It has been shown to form a heterodimer with Smad4 and transactivate gene epression.It hasn't been shown that it binds directly to DNA though as Smad4 has been.

Description: POZ (BTB) and AT hook containing zinc finger 1
Taxa: Transcription Factor Binding: tf co-factor binding; DNA-Binding: sequence-specific
Reviewer Commments: GST pull-down and yeast two-hybrid assays indicate MAZR (Zfp278) and Bach2 interact. EMSA indicates an association between MAZR and Bach2 on DNA. A transfection assay in the pro-B-cell line shows MAZR activates the c-myc promoter.

Description: Cbp/p300-interacting transactivator, with Glu/Asp-rich carboxy-terminal domain, 4
Taxa: Transcription Factor Binding: tf co-factor binding
Reviewer Commments: from OMIM "CITED4 belongs to a family of transcriptional coactivators that bind several proteins, including CREB-binding protein (MIM 600140) and p300 (MIM 602700)"

Taxa: Transcription Factor Binding: tf co-factor binding
Reviewer Commments: HDAC7 is involved in repression of MEF2 transcription factors' activity. Its own activity is controlled by a shttling between the nucleus and the cytoplasm. There are a lot of evidence of its co-repressor activity in different contexts.

Taxa: Transcription Factor Binding: tf co-factor binding
Reviewer Commments: This gene was initially identified as interacting directly with of proteins of the mammalian Polycomb complex (Ring1A, Ring1B, and M33) by 2-hybrid, co-immunoprecipitation, and/or GST pulldown (PMID: 10369680).  It also iteracts physically with YY1 by GST pulldown.  By reporter co-transfection assay with a GAL4 fusion protein, RYBP acted as a repressor.RYBP was also been identified as a protein that interacts with E2F2 and E2F3 by 2-hybrid analysis (PMID: 12411495).  By reporter transfection assays, synergistic activation of the Cdc6 promoter by YY1, RYBP and E2F3 is observed (PMID: 12411495).  By Chip assay, YY1, E2F and RYB all interact with the Cdc6 and RR1 promoters.This protein contains a ZnF_RBZ domain, of which the defining member is Ran, which is a protein that regulates transport between the nucleus and the cytoplasm.  Of ten other mouse proteins with this domain catalogued by SMART, none is obviously a transcription factor.  Therefore, although GO annotations include DNA-binding, there is no supporting evidence for direct DNA-binding by Rybp.
Gel shift and UV-crosslinking experiments indicate DREAM (Csen) binds DRE. Transient transfection assays in HEK293 cells show DREAM functions as a transcriptional repressor.

Taxa: Transcription Factor Binding: tf co-factor binding
Reviewer Commments: PIAS1 is associated with Stat1 in coimmunoprecipitation assays. EMSA indicates PIAS1 can inhibit the DNA binding activity of Stat1. Luciferase reporter assays in transfected human 293 cells  indicate PIAS1 inhibits Stat1-mediated gene activation.

FOXO3A bound DNA in a gel shift assay performed using oligonucleotides encoding the forkhead binding sites in the IGFBP1 and Fas ligand gene promoters and protein extracts prepared from 293T cells transfectred with a FOXO3a expression vector together with a consitutively active form of Akt. Antibody supershift confirmed the participation of FOXO3a in the retarded complex observed in the gel shift experiments.FOXO3A transactivates a construct containing the Fas ligand forkhead binding sites following transient cotransfection in CCL39 fibroblasts.

Plag1 is a transcription factor. Plag1 binds a consensus sequence composed of a core GRGGC followed 6–8 nucleotides further by a cluster of at least three guanidines (G-cluster) (by cyclic amplification and selection of targets and EMSA). Plag1 stimulates an artificial promoter-reporter composed of six copies of the minimal consensus sequences and also binds and activates IGF-II promoter-reporter genes.

Taxa: Transcription Factor Binding: tf co-factor binding
Reviewer Commments: Rnf14 is a TF gene.  The recombinant human protein was shown to interact with the recombinant androgen receptor in in vitro coimmunoprecipitation experiments.  It also increased transactivation by the androgen, glucocorticoid, progesterone, and estrogen receptors in CAT reporter gene assays in transient transfection experiments.

Description: zinc finger and BTB domain containing 33

Taxa: Transcription Factor Binding: tf co-factor binding; DNA-Binding: sequence-specific
Reviewer Commments: Based on the interaction tests and DNA binding tests, GMEB1 is a GME-motif-binding protein that can form heterodimer with GMEB2 or form homomultimers, and affect transcription activity. There is some evidence that it can interact with GR and act as a cofactor.

Function: Co-activation; DNA Binding; TF PPI; Transactivation

Description: general transcription factor II I repeat domain-containing 1
Reviewer Commments: Gtf2ird1 binds to DICE sequences in the the Ig germline H-chain 186.2 gene promoter in gel shift assays.Gtf2ird1 knock-down, using stem-loop siRNAs expressed in pcDNA-U6hygro, results in increased IgH promoter activity in 70Z/3 B cells.
Tbx20 shows a clear specific DNA-binding activity. It seems to have a predominant repressor activity though it might act as an activator in specific conditions.

Description: SWI/SNF related, matrix associated, actin dependent regulator of chromatin, subfamily e, member 1
Taxa: Transcription Factor Binding: tf co-factor binding
Reviewer Commments: Smarce1 is a SWI/SNF subunit present only in mammalian complexes, which are ATP-dependent chromatin remodelling enzymes implicated in the regulation of gene expression.Smarce1 seems to be linked to different nuclear receptor signalling (at least ER and AR), as it was shown to be essential for coactivation by p160 HAT family members of the nuclear response elements.There is support for a role for SWI/SNF complexes and histone acetyltransferases in transcriptional activation by NRs.

This gene encodes an apparent member of the T-box family of transcription factors involved in the immune response.  It was identified by a yeast one hybrid approach using the IL-2 promoter (-400 to −40) linked to the HIS3 reporter gene (PMID: 10761931).  In a cotransfection assay, it could transactivate a reporter construct containing the entire IFNγ locus, which includes three potential T-box consensus binding sequences, but it repressed the IL-2 promoter (PMID: 10761931).  T-bet protein can be “immunoprecipitated” by biotinylated oligonucleotides containing wild-type but not mutated T-box binding sites (PMID: 16275766).  By co-immunoprecipitation, T-bet associates with NF-kappaB RelA (PMID: 16275766) and also with GATA-3, and it also interferes with GATA-3 DNA-binding in a gel-shift assay (PMID: 15662016).

Taxa: Transcription Factor Binding: tf co-factor binding
Reviewer Commments: SEI-2 (Sertad2) is co-immunoprecipitated with DNA-binding transcription factor CBP. Expression of SEI-2 strongly stimulates p53-dependent gene activation in HeLa and U2OS cells.

Sall1 is likely a transcription factor, which recruits the HDAC complex to promoters in order to regulate transcription. Sall1 strongly represses reporter gene expression (>100-fold relative to reporter vector alone) when cotransfected into COS-1 cells with a luciferase reporter vector. Also, the further addition of a Histone Deacetylase Complex (HDAC) inhibitor TSA to this assay leads to an increase in reporter expression. As well, Sall1 interacts with subunits of the HDAC as demonstrated by GST-pulldown assay. The DNA binding site for Sall1 has not yet been determined.

#JR#2-23-06human ortholog is MLXIPL; GeneID:  51085human EntrezGene: "This gene encodes a basic helix-loop-helix leucine zipper transcription factor of the Myc/Max/Mad superfamily. This protein forms a heterodimeric complex and binds and activates, in a glucose-dependent manner, carbohydrate response element (ChoRE) motifs in the promoters of triglyceride synthesis genes."

Taxa: Transcription Factor Binding: tf co-factor binding
Reviewer Commments: Yeast two-hybrid screening and co-immunoprecipitation indicates PIASy (Pias4) interacts with DNA-binding transcription factor p53. PIASy inhibits p53’s ability to transactivate a p21/luciferase reporter construct.

Two distinct FOXJ2 consensus binding sites (designated Type A and B) were identified in binding site selection experiments performed using bacterially expresed GST:FOXJ2 fusion proteins. FOXJ2 contacts within the Type B binding site were identified by footprinting.FOXJ2 activated transcription using reporter constructs containing either 5 copies of the Type A consensus binding site or 4 copies of the Type B site site cloned upstream of a minimal promoter and transfected into Hep3B cells. A Gal4-FOXOJ2 fusion protein displayed constitutive activity following transient transfection into Hep3B cells.

Description: myeloid/lymphoid or mixed-lineage leukemia (trithorax homolog, Drosophila); translocated to, 1
Taxa: Transcription Factor Binding: tf co-factor binding
Reviewer Commments: Mllt1 is a TF gene.  Recombinant murine Mllt1 co-transactivated a luciferase reporter construct in transient cotransfections, and was shown to interact with INI1/SNF5 (a member of the SWI/SNF complex that remodels chromatin and activates transcription) in coimmunoprecipitation experiments.

Description: zinc finger protein of the cerebellum 5

Taxa: DNA-Binding: sequence-specific; Transcription Factor Binding: tf co-factor binding
Reviewer Commments: EMSAs using KLF15 indicate this protein specifically binds to a probe containing the Krüppel-like family DNA consensus sequence. Co-immunoprecipitation assays show that KLF15 specifically interacts with DNA-binding transcription factor MEF2A. In co-transfection assays in 3T3-L1 cells, KLF15 and MEF2A synergistically activate the GLUT4 promoter.

Taxa: Transcription Factor Binding: tf co-factor binding
Reviewer Commments: Skiip is a TF gene.  In reporter assays, human recombinant Skiip was found to enhance transcription mediated by recombinant vitamin D receptor (VDR), recombinant glucocorticoid receptor (GR), retinoic acid receptor (RAR), and recombinant estrogen receptor (ER) in the presence of their appropriate ligands during transient cotransfection experiments.  It was shown to interact with VDR in vitro in GST pull-down experiments of in vitro transcribed and translated NCoA-62 incubated with GST-VDR.

Description: TAF12 RNA polymerase II, TATA box binding protein (TBP)-associated factor
Taxa: Basal Transcription Factor; Transcription Factor Binding: tf co-factor binding
Reviewer Commments: Transfected hTAF20 (Taf12) is coprecipitated with TBP in COS cells. ATF7 and TAF12 interact in co-immunoprecipitation and GST pull-down assays. ChIP assays indicate ATF7 and TAF12 target the genomic E-selectin promoter. Transfection assays in Cos-1 cells show ATF7-induced transactivation is mediated by hsTAF12.

Taxa: Transcription Factor Binding: tf co-factor binding
Reviewer Commments: Endogenous DRAP1 coimmunoprecipitates with transcription factor FoxH1 transfected in cells and GST-FoxH1 in vitro. In an EMSA, binding of a FoxH1 transcription factor complex (ARF) to the Xenopus Mix.2 promoter is inhibited by addition of DRAP1. Overexpression of DRAP1 inhibits Nodal activity in cotransfection assays (293T cells).

Rat Gtf3a (TFIIIA) was cloned by degenerate PCR and RACE using primers directed against highly conserved sequence in fingers I and IX of amphibain TFIIIA sequences. Recombinant rat and xenopus Gtf3a proteins, ( expressed in bacteria and purified on BIO REX 70 columns), demonstrated identical DNase I footprints on the Xenopus 5S RNA promoter.Murine Gtf3a clones were identified by an EST database search using the rat cDNA sequence. The resulting mouse clones appeared to lack the full Gtf3a N-terminus. Recombinant mouse and Xenopus Gtf3a proteins protected an identical region of the Xenopus 5S RNA promoter in DNase I studies.

Description: SWI/SNF related, matrix associated, actin dependent regulator of chromatin, subfamily a, member 2
Taxa: Transcription Factor Binding: tf co-factor binding
Reviewer Commments: Human brm (Smarca2) is copurified with members of the chromatin-binding SNF2/SWI2 complex. Human brm can function as a transcriptional activator when fused to a heterologous DNA binding domain. Transfected hbrm cooperates with the glucocorticoid receptor (GR) in transcriptional activation.

Taxa: Transcription Factor Binding: tf co-factor binding
Reviewer Commments: Yeast two-hybrid studies and GST pull-down assays indicate interaction of NRIF3 (Itgb3bp) with selective liganded nuclear receptors. GFP studies indicate NRIF3 localizes to the cell nucleus. Transfection studies carried out in HeLa cells show NRIF3 selectively potentiates TR- and RXR-mediated transactivation.

Description: TAF11 RNA polymerase II, TATA box binding protein (TBP)-associated factor
Taxa: Basal Transcription Factor; Transcription Factor Binding: tf co-factor binding
Reviewer Commments: The TATA-binding protein (TBP)-associated factors (TAFs) of TFIID play a central role in RNA polymerase II transcriptional regulation. Some TAFs can function as co-activators that mediate the activation signal from enhancer-bound regulators. In addition, interactions between selected TAFs and core elements direct promoter selectivity by RNA polymerase II.Taf11 has mostly been reported to act as a coactivator.

Taxa: Transcription Factor Binding: tf co-factor binding
Reviewer Commments: GST pull-down assays and yeast two-hybrid tests show ASC-1 (Ascc1) binds transcription factors including basal factors and nuclear receptors. Indirect immunofluorescence studies indicate ASC-1 can be localized in the nucleus. Cotransfection assays in CV-1 cells suggest ASC-1 is a transcription coactivator of nuclear receptors.

ELF2 (NERF2) synthesized in reticulocyte lysates binds to the lyn promoter Ets site in gel shift assays.ELF2 activates a reporter construct containing two copies of the lyn or blk promoter Ets sites following transient transfection in HeLa cells.

Description: myeloid/lymphoid or mixed-lineage leukemia (trithorax homolog, Drosophila); translocated to, 3
Taxa: Transcription Factor Binding: tf co-factor binding; Transcription Regulatory Activity: heterochromatin interaction/binding
Reviewer Commments: Two hybrid, GST pulldown and colocalization assays demonstrate that AF9 binds the a isoform of mBCL-6 corepressor (BCoR) as well as Dot1a (verifed also by coimmunoprecipitation). Cotransfection of an BCoR-a suppresses AF9-stimulated luciferase activity to 40% of the baseline value. Cotransfection reporter gene assays indicate that Dot1a and AF9 function together to down-regulate ENaC{alpha} promoter activity. ChIP assays reveal Dot1a and AF9 are associated with the promoter, and suggest methylation is the result of the proteins' activity.

Taxa: Transcription Factor Binding: tf co-factor binding
Reviewer Commments: HDAC8 represses transcription mediated by the SV40 early promoter following transient transfection in Rat-2 cells fibroblasts. The repression mediated by HDAC8 is partially reversed by treatment with trichostatin.

DBD Classification (Protein Group/Protei: Other Alpha-Helix Group/High Mobility Group (Box) Family
Reviewer Commments: Human Cic is likely a transcription factor, which represses gene expression through interactions with DNA binding elements. Cic-GAL4DBD represses luciferase expression when transfected into HeLa cells with a luciferase reporter vector. Also, the HMG-box domain of Cic binds to an 8 bp sequence within the human ERM minimal promoter as detected by EMSA and Supershift assays.
Mobility shift and DNase I footprint analysis show ALF can form stable ternary complexes with TBP and the AdML promoter.

Nanog was identified in a digital differential display experiment that compared ESTs obtained from ES cells and differentiated tissues.A consensus Nanog binding site (5'-CAGCCATTAaC-3') was identied in binding site selection studies (SELEX) performed with a purified MBP-Nanog fusion protein.Nanog contains two transactivation domains that were identified by transiently transfection of HEK293 cells with fusion proteins containing fragments of Nanog linked to the Gal4-DBD. The intact Nanog protein tranactivated a synthetic contstuct containing two copies of it's consensus response element following transient transfection in HEK293T cells.

My own laboratory (TRH) uses nanog as a positive control for DNA-binding assays so I strongly believe that it is a sequence-specific DNA-binding protein.  Association with specific genomic DNA sequences in vivo has also been verified (PMID: 16153702).  PMID: 16518401 (which is in press) appears to contain RNAi-based evidence that Nanog regulates genes that it binds.  Pan and Pei (PMID: 15502159) used reporter cotransfection assays to show that Nanog can act as a transactivator but this activity may be context-dependent.

Description: BRF1 homolog, subunit of RNA polymerase III transcription initiation factor IIIB (S. cerevisiae)
Reviewer Commments: Shown to bind AU-rich Elements of mRNA in mouse,  activating degradation.   Sequence contains transcription initiation factor domain (function in yeast).  Function in human differs from function in yeast - is needed for proper transcription of VIA promoter,  but not needed for transcription of U6 promoter.   Is part of the TBP-containing portion of the TFIIIB (RNA pol III)

Description: TAF4B RNA polymerase II, TATA box binding protein (TBP)-associated factor
Taxa: Transcription Factor Binding: tf co-factor binding
Reviewer Commments: Taf4b is a TF gene.  Taf4b from murine ovarian extracts interacts with the cell type-specific subunit of TFIID, called TAFII105, and TATA-binding protein (TBP) in immunoprecipitation studies. Luciferase reporter assays in spontaneously immortalized granulosa cells (SIGCs) and NIH/3T3 cells stably overexpressing Taf4b show that Taf4b transactivates granulosa cell-specific promoters on transiently transfected reporter constructs, such as the inhibin-α (Inha) and -βA (Inhba) subunit promoters, and the cyclin D2 (Ccnd2) and follistatin (Fst) promoters.

Taxa: Transcription Factor Binding: tf co-factor binding
Reviewer Commments: ccnt2 is one possible regulatory subunit of the complexe P-TEFb. P-TEFb contains Cdk9 and a C-type cyclin (CycT1, CycT2a, CycT2b or CycK). Cdk9 in P-TEFb phosphorylates the C-terminal domain (CTD) of RNAPII.Ccnt2 has been shown to bind directly to RNAPII and this interaction is key for its transcriptional effects.It is also part of a complexe with MyoD, involved in MyoD transcriptional activation.It was shown that Ccnt2 can activate transcription when tethered artificially to DNA.It is possible though that the involvment of ccnt2 is only through the kinase activity of cdk9 which would give it more a role in signalling than in transcription itself.

Description: nuclear factor of activated T-cells, cytoplasmic, calcineurin-dependent 4
Taxa: Transcription Factor Binding: tf co-factor binding
Reviewer Commments: NFATc4 interacts with DNA-binding transcription factor CBP in GST pull-down assays using recombinant proteins. Cotransfection assays indicate NFATc4 and CBP cooperate to regulate transcriptional activity.

Nfatc4 is a transcription factor.  It activates transcription of an NFAT luciferase reporter plasmid in transient cotransfection experiments.  It also binds to promoter elements in the IL-2, PPARγ2 and adiponectin promoters in electrophoretic mobility shift assays, and does not bind to mutated or non-specific oligonucleotides.

GeneID: 73181Referring to PMID: 16644691NFATc4 is a transcription factor. When cotransfected with adiponectin reporter constructs, NFATc4 stimulated 50% increases in reporter activity. Futhermore, these increases in reporter expression were observed only in the presence of the putative NFAT-binding site. Using EMSA assays, NFATc4 was also shown to interact with a 20 bp region within the adiponectin promoter from mouse 3T3-L1 adipocytes, mouse white adipose tissue, and human HEK293 kidney cells. In addition, ChIP assays were also performed, lending in-vivo confidence to this claim.
Evidence that NFATc4 regulates the transcription of several promoters and binds to these promoters (adiponectin,  cTNi)

EMSA using in vitro translated proteins indicates Foxp4 binds specifically to the consensus forkhead site in the CC10 promoter. Upon cotransfection with Foxp4 plasmids, activity of the mouse CC10 promoter is significantly repressed.

Description: jumonji, AT rich interactive domain 1B (Rbp2 like)
Taxa: Transcription Factor Binding: tf co-factor binding
Reviewer Commments: Jarid1b is a transcription factor. Jarid1v interacts with BF-1 and PAX9 by yeast two-hybrid assay and immunoprecipitation assays. A Gal4-Jarid1v fusion protein reduces the basal expression of the reporter gene and co-expression of BF-1 further represses reporter gene activation through a motif required for interaction (by reporter gene assay with deletion/mutation analysis).

Description: DCP1 decapping enzyme homolog A (S. cerevisiae)
Taxa: Transcription Factor Binding: tf co-factor binding
Reviewer Commments: SMIF (Dcp1a) was cloned from a human pancreatic cDNA library in a yeast two-hybrid experiment using SMAD4 as bait. the mouse homolog was cloned from a 17d whole-embryo library.TGF-beta treatment induces the nuclear translocation of SMAD4/SMIF in Mv1Lu mink lung cells.A fusion protein containing SMIF linked to the Lex DNA-binding domain activated transcription in yeast. A Gal4-SMIF fusion protein demonstrated TGF-beta, SMAD4 and CBP/p300-dependent transactivation.

Taxa: Transcription Factor Binding: tf co-factor binding
Reviewer Commments: The zipzap/p200 (Arid2) protein has two classic C2H2 zinc fingers. Zipzap/p200 co-immunoprecipitates with SRF and SRF cofactors, however a mammalian two-hybrid system suggests only a weak interaction between SRF and zipzap. Zipzap/p200 with SRF activated the promoter activity of cardiac actin, MLC2v, and ANF genes. Zipzap/p200 co-transfected with another SRF cofactor, myocardin, results in synergistic activation of the ANF promoter.

Creb3l4 synthesized in rabbit reticoulcyte lysates binds to the unfolded protein response element (UPRE) and the NF-kappaB response element in gel shift assay.An aciidic domain in Creb3l4 activates transcription as a GAL4-DBD fusion protein following transient transfection in HeLa S3 cells. Full length Creb3l4 (Tisp40beta) activated transcription from a UPRE-containing reporter plasmid following transient transfection in HeLa S3 cells. Creb3l4 isoforms lacking the acidic activation domain (Tispa40alpha) have been coloned from mouse testis where it is expressed in spermatids.

Taxa: Transcription Regulatory Activity: heterochromatin interaction/binding; Transcription Factor Binding: tf co-factor binding
Reviewer Commments: Hdac9 encodes a histone deacetylase-like protein that is expressed in brain and muscle and that has several isoforms.  FLAG-tagged Hdac9 immunoprecipitates contain both histone deacetylase activity and the muscle-related MEF2 transcription factor (PMID: 11535832).  Reporter cotransfection assays show that HDAC9 represses transcription of a MEF2-responsive promoter, but not an unrelated promoter (PMID: 11535832).  At least one of the isoforms also co-purifies with heterochromatin protein 1 (HP1), an adaptor protein that recognizes methylated lysines within histone tails and mediates transcriptional repression by recruiting histone methyltransferase, by both yeast 2-hybrid and IPs from cotransfected COS cells (PMID: 12242305).

Description: basic helix-loop-helix domain containing, class B3
Taxa: DNA-Binding: sequence-specific; Transcription Factor Binding: tf co-factor binding
Transcription Factor Binding: tf co-factor binding
Reviewer Commments: JDP2 is a transcription factor. It interacts with ATF-2 (by EMSA) and is a component of the differentiation regulatory factor (DRF) complex by supershift assays. JDP2 represses DRE-dependent transactivation by ATF-2 and p300 in F9 cells by CAT reporter assay and inhibit retinoic acid-mediated activation in F9 cells (by c-jun promoter reporter assay) and RA-inducible gene expression in F9 cells by real-time RT-PCR.

Description: SWI/SNF related, matrix associated, actin dependent regulator of chromatin, subfamily d, member 1
Reviewer Commments: This gene encodes a component of a protein complex believed to function in ATP-dependent chromatin-remodelling, initially described on the basis of cDNA cloning and biochemical purification of proteins with strong similarity to a yeast protein complex (SWI/SNF) with this function (PMID: 8804307).  The mouse protein, overexpressed in cell culture, can mediate interactions between cardiac transcription factors and the BAF complex ATPase Brg1, thereby potentiating the activation of target genes (PMID: 15525990).  However, there appears to be no evidence of direct contact with DNA.

Tbx19 (Tpit) expressed as an MBP fusion protein in bacteria bound to the CE3 element of the proopiomelanocortin gene (POMC) in gel shift assays.Tbx19 augmented transcription by a reporter gene containing the POMC CE3 element following transient transfection in CV-1 and GH3 cells.

Taxa: Transcription Factor Binding: tf co-factor binding
Reviewer Commments: Setdb1 is a transcription factor. Setdb1 posesses H3 histone methyltransferase activity and this activity is further stimulated by interaction with mAM transcription factor as demonstrated by HMTase assays and ChIP assays. ESET and ESET complexs prefer nonnucleosomal histone H3 substrates by methylation of histone H3, either in complex with other core histones or in mono- or oligonucleosomes.

Taxa: Transcription Factor Binding: tf co-factor binding
Reviewer Commments: Yeast two-hybrid, GST pull-down, and in vivo immunoprecipitation studies indicate SNURF interacts specifically with the DBD of AR (Androgen Receptor). SNURF is shown to localize in the nucleus. Overexpression of SNURF in cultured mammalian cells enhances androgen receptor-dependent transactivation.
ARID1A is part of the large ATP-dependent chromatin remodeling complex SNF/SWI, which is required for transcriptional activation of genes normally repressed by chromatin

Taxa: Transcription Factor Binding: tf co-factor binding
Reviewer Commments: Roaz (Zfp423) is identified as an interactor of DNA-binding transcription factor O/E-1 in yeast two-hybrid, GST-affinity purification, and coimmunoprecipitation experiments. Cotransfection and luciferase assays in HEK293 cells indicate Roaz and O/E-1 modulate transcription.

Human Arid4b (referred to as SAP180 in this PMID) is likely a transcriptional cofactor, which represses gene expression in a complex with a variety of other co-repressor proteins. Arid4b represses luciferase reporter expression when fused to the GAL4-DBD and cotransfected into HEK-293 cells along with a luciferase reporter vector. In addition, Arid4b interacts with each of the components of the mSIN3A corepressor complex as demonstrated by co-immunoprecipitation from K562 nuclear extracts. This suggests that transcriptional repression by Arid4b is achieved via the action of Histone Deacetylase (HDAC). However, the addition of HDAC inhibitor TSA to the cotransfection experiment did not impact upon the ability of Arid4b to repress expression suggesting that it may be by other means.

Description: high mobility group nucleosomal binding domain 3
Reviewer Commments: HMG3 was initally identified in a two-hybrid experiment designed to identify proteins that interacted with the thyroid hormone receptor carboxy terminus.HMGN3, expressed in bacteria as an His epitope tagged protein, binds to nucleosome core particles in gel shift assays. Random amplified polymorphic DNA (RAPD) analysis demonstrates that this binding displays no sequence specificity. Microarray analysis was used to identifiy prospective HMGN3 target genes in transiently transfected mouse Hepa-1 hepatoma cells. The differentially regulated targets included the glycine transporter 1 gene (Glyt1). HMGN3 induction of Glyt1 was confirmed by RT-PCR using RNA obtained from transiently transfected Hepa-1 cells. Chromatin immunoprecipitation studies demonstrated that HMGN3 interacted with the Glyt1 gene promoter in the same cell line.

Taxa: Transcription Factor Binding: tf co-factor binding
Reviewer Commments: TAZ (Wwtr1) physically associates with DNA-binding transcription factor TBX5 in coimmunoprecipitation and pull down assays. Luciferase reporter assays in COS-1 cells indicate TAZ is a coactivator for TBX5.

DBD Classification (Protein Group/Protei: Other Alpha-Helix Group/High Mobility Group (Box) Family
Taxa: DNA-Binding: non-sequence-specific; Transcription Factor Binding: tf co-factor binding
Reviewer Commments: Hmgb2 is a TF gene.  The recombinant protein was shown to bind to plasmid DNA in gel retardation assays.  In transient cotransfections, recombinant human HMGB2 was shown to repress p53- and p73-dependent transactivation from a luciferase reporter plasmid.  Native human  HMGB2 was shown to associate with HMGB1 and a nuclear DNA-protein complex in coimmunoprecipitation and EMSA studies.

Taxa: DNA-Binding: non-sequence-specific; Transcription Factor Binding: tf co-factor binding; Transcription Regulatory Activity: heterochromatin interaction/binding
Reviewer Commments: Sall4 is a transcription factor implicated in the mouse limb and heart patterning, which binds to DNA sequences either alone or in complex with other transcription factors, and thereby regulates transcription. Sall4 influences levels of reporter gene expression when cotransfected into 10T1/2 cells along with reporter constructs containing either mouse Fgf10, Gja15 or Nppa promoter sequences. This regulation is modified upon the further transfection of Tbx family members. Sall4 binds directly to transcription factor Nanog, as demonstrated by reciprocal Chromatin Immunoprecipitations from mouse embryonic stem cells.

Function: Co-activation; DNA Binding; TF PPI; Transactivation

Taxa: Transcription Factor Binding: tf co-factor binding
Reviewer Commments: TRRAP is purified from nuclear extracts as an interactor of the DNA-binding transcription factor c-myc. Interaction confirmed with coprecipitation studies. Transfection assays indicate TRRAP interaction correlates with cellular transformation by c-Myc.

Phox2b is a direct target of Hoxb in vitro. Hoxb2 transactivates Phox2b enhancer-luciferase reporter construct in murine embryonal carcinoma P19 cells. Hox2b induces Phox2b transcription can be further increased by Pbx1a and Prep1 co-factors.

ETV5 protein produced by in vitro translation in wheat germ extract binds to the E74 Ets-binding site in gel shift assays.ETV5 activates the human ICAM-1 minmal promoter and 3xE74-TK-Luc reporter plasmids following transient transfection in RK13 cells.Etv5 activates the murine bax promoter (bp –2673 to –1) following transient transfection in TAC-2.1 cells.

EMSA and luciferase assay confirm binding to specific recognition site in MPO promoter and transactivation.   Protein is similar to other PEBP2/CBF (polyomavirus enhancer-binding facter 2/core binding factor) transcriptional activators.

Taxa: Transcription Factor Binding: tf co-factor binding
Reviewer Commments: coREST is REST co-repressor. The complex exhibits repressor activity.coREST seems to influence DNA methylation at least in the context of the BHC complex that includes the histone demethylase BHC110. It seems to enhance the association between BHC110 and nucleosomes, leading to increased nucleosomal demethylation.

Reviewer Commments: In addition to its role as a sequence-specific transcription factor, this protein can also bind to Smad3 and function as a cofactor, contributing as a repressor.

Description: RRN3 RNA polymerase I transcription factor homolog (yeast)
Taxa: Transcription Factor Binding: tf co-factor binding
Reviewer Commments: #JR#2-7-06OMIM:"Eukaryotic ribosomal RNA (rRNA) genes are transcribed by an enzyme solely dedicated to that purpose, RNA polymerase I (Pol I; see 602000), and their expression is coordinated with cellular growth rate. Using the protein sequence of the yeast Pol I transcription factor Rrn3, Moorefield et al. (2000) identified EST sequences which they used to isolate a partial RRN3 cDNA clone from human Jurkat cell RNA. By 5-prime and 3-prime RACE, they cloned several cDNA fragments which were joined at overlapping restriction enzyme sites to produce an ORF encoding a 587-amino acid protein that shares 21% sequence similarity as well as immunologic cross-reactivity with the yeast Rrn3 transcription factor."Rrn3 is an rRNA TF. NCBI "Conserved Domain" search idenitifies only pfam05327.5 (RRN3: RNA polymerase I specific transcription initiation factor RRN3. This family consists of several eukaryotic proteins which are homologous to the yeast RRN3 protein. RRN3 is one of the RRN genes specifically required for the transcription of rDNA by RNA polymerase I (Pol I) in Saccharomyces cerevisiae.). There is no direct experimental evidence of DNA binding in mammmals, so this gene is therefore could conceivable be considered for the ontology notation "DNA-binding: sequence-specific".

Description: BTAF1 RNA polymerase II, B-TFIID transcription factor-associated, (Mot1 homolog, S. cerevisiae)
Reviewer Commments: Together Btaf1 and the TATA-binding protein (TBP) are the major components of TFIID (see PMID:14557059 for Review). The amino terminus of hTAFII170 is found to interact with hTBP through deletion mutation analysis in a yeast two-hybrid system. Results are confirmed with GST pull-down and coimmunoprecipitation assays.

Atf5 is a transcription factor. It interacts with TAF12 (by immunoprecipitation) and binds an E-selectin promoter by ChIP assay. It activates a Gal4 reporter gene fused to a GAL4 DNA binding domain demonstrating that it contains an active transcriptional activation domain and this activation potential is enhanced when TAF12 is present. It also activates a reporter gene containing the nutrient-sensing response unit of the asparagine synthetase gene.
movo is a transcription factor gene with at least 3 splice variants, of which at least one shows DNA binding and can be self-activated by MOVO-C variant, as shown by EMSA and transfection studies.
#JR#2-7-06This is a homeobox gene but is not in a HOX locus. It appears to be developmentally active and may have transactivation properties.

The mammalian counterpart of the yeast holoenzyme has been less studied.

Description: TAF9 RNA polymerase II, TATA box binding protein (TBP)-associated factor
Reviewer Commments: RNA polymerase II transcription factor IID is a complex of the TATA binding protein and a variety of TBP-associated factors (TAFs). The TAFs are required for activated rather than basal transcription and serve to mediate signals between various activators and the basal transcriptional machinery. Taf9 is one of these TBP-associated factors.Klemm et al. (1995) cloned a human TFIID subunit, which they termed hTAFII32. The 32-kD protein was isolated from HeLa cell nuclear extracts and partially sequenced. A degenerate oligomer was designed and used to probe a human HeLa cell cDNA library. The identified cDNA has a deduced amino acid sequence of 264 residues and is related to the Drosophila TAFII40. Klemm et al. (1995) showed that TAFII32 interacts with GTF2B and with the viral transcriptional transactivator VP16. The authors showed that recombinantly expressed TAFII32 was functional in a partial recombinant TFIID complex and that the recombinant complex mediated activation by a GAL4-VP16 fusion protein. Lu and Levine (1995) cloned TAF9, which they called TAFII31. TAF9 encodes a 264-amino acid protein. Immunoprecipitation and binding analyses showed interaction of TAF9 with the N-terminal domain of p53 at sites identical to those bound by MDM2, the major cellular negative regulator of p53 activity. Antibodies to TAF9 inhibited p53-activated transcription. Lu and Levine (1995) concluded that p53 activity is regulated by 2 proteins competing for the same region of the p53 protein.

From OMIM: "Li and Tucker (1993) cloned a glutamine-rich factor, which they designated QRF1, that is expressed preferentially at the terminal differentiation stage of B cells and in skeletal muscle. The deduced 707-amino acid QRF1 protein contains an 84-amino acid segment that shows significant sequence homology with the DNA-binding domains of the hepatocyte nuclear factor-3/forkhead family of proteins."

Taxa: Transcription Factor Binding: tf co-factor binding
Reviewer Commments: Trip230 (Trip11) is shown to interact with TR (thyroid hormone receptor) in a yeast two-hybrid screen as well as coimmunoprecipitation experiments. Trip230 enhances TR-regulated transcription in transient transfection assays.

EMSA indicates HOXC11 binds to specific promoter elements including SIF1-24 and CE-LPH1-24.  Transfection assays in Caco-2 cells show HOXC11 stimulates HNF1alpha -dependent transcription from the LPH promoter.

Description: human immunodeficiency virus type I enhancer binding protein 1
nuclear receptor subfamily 3, group C, member 2
Reviewer Commments: NR3C2 was cloned by screening a human genomic DNA library with a probe derived from the human glucocorticoid receptor. NR3C2, expressed in Sf21 insect cells, bound to probes containing a glucocorticoid reponse element (GRE) in gel shift assays.  NR3C2 induced expression, in reponse to aldosterone treatment, of a reporter construct containing the MMTV-LTR in transiently transfected CV-1 cells. NR3C2 interaction with the GREs contained in the MMTV-LTR was confirmed by DNaseI footprinting.

The protein binds DNA directly by gel-shift assay (PMID: 14701752).  The repression activity requires the binding site to be part of the reporter construct, which demonstrates sequence specificity (PMID: 14701752).

Description: transducin-like enhancer of split 6, homolog of Drosophila E(spl)
Taxa: Transcription Factor Binding: tf co-factor binding
Reviewer Commments: Tle6 is a transcription factor, which regulates gene expression in complex with other transcription factors. Tle6 associates with transcription factor BF-1 as demonstrated by co-immunoprecipitation, and modulates the transcriptional repression activity of BF-1 as demonstrated by cotransfection. As well, Tle6 cannot inherently repress transcription, and does not inherently modulate the ability of Tle1 to repress transcription as demonstrated by cotransfection. Instead it is thought that it may compete with Tle1 for binding to BF-1 and thereby bring about decreased gene expression.

This gene encodes a protein that is a component of a complex required for RNA polymerase II to transcribe through chromatin (PMID: 10421373).  It destabilizes nucleosomal structure so that one histone H2A-H2B dimer is removed during enzyme passage (PMID: 12934006).  I did not read all 15 papers about this gene and it is not clear to me which of this information comes from yeast and how much comes from mouse/human; however, it is evident that the encoded protein does at least have similar activities in both yeast and human on the basis of biochemical studies.  Therefore I think it can be considered a "TF gene" and I am classifying it as a "Basal Transcription Factor" although it could also be deemed as interacting with chromatin (but probably not heterochromatin).

This is a homeodomain protein that binds to oligonucleotides containing “P3”, an instance of a classical homeobox (TAATTAAATTA) but not a mutated control sequence (TccTTAAAggA) by gel-shift (PMID: 11978762).  It acts as a transcriptional repressor in a cotransfection reporter assay (PMID: 15647262).

Reviewer Commments: DNase I footprinting and ChIP assays show MTA1 binds a region of the MMP-9 promoter. Co-immunoprecipitation and ChIP experiments reveal the MTA1-dependent recruitment of HDAC2 to this promoter region. Enforced MTA1 expression in HT1080 cells reduces MMP-9 protein/mRNA levels.

Klf16 is a transcription factor. It binds the basic transcription element (BTE) site from the CYP1A1 promoter invivo and invitro by EMSA and immunoprecipitation/PCR amplification. Klf16 N-terminus region represses Gal4 reporter activity (by Gal4-BTEB4 fusion assay) and activates CYP1A1 promoter-reporters in transfected HepG2 cells. In addition, GST pull-down and immunoprecipitation assays show that BTEB4 can interact with the co-repressor mSin3A in vitro and in CHO cells.

Otx3 HD shows strong binding to the HD consensus sequence in EMSA. Co-transfection of GH3 cells with pP3Ctk-Luc and pCMV-Otx2 stimulated luciferase activity to 29-fold the activity in cells transfected with pP3Ctk-Luc alone.

Sp7 is a transcription factor. It binds the Sp1 DNA binding site by EMSA and interacts with NFATc by EMSA and coimmunoprecipitation assays. Sp7 transactivates a Col1a1 promoter-reporter gene and a Gal4-reporter gene (by a Gal4-Osx fusion protein) and this activity is further stimulated by cotransfections with NFAT.

Reviewer Commments: RFXAP is a transcription factor. RFXAP is activates of HLA-DR expression in RFXAP-deficient ABI fibroblasts and in the 6.1.6 (RFXAP defective) cell lines (by FACS/mCD8 expression analysis and EMSA). The isotype-specific region of RFXAP is essential in vivo for promoter occupation by RFX and recruitment of CIITA to the DQB and DPB promoters by chromatin immunoprecipitation experiments using an antibody directed against the largest subunit of RFX and EMSA in an in vitro-generated mutant cell line (6.1.6) characterized by a defect in MHCII expression and in a Raji cell line.

Deacetylase assays indicate HDAC10 has histone deacetylase activity. Coimmunoprecipitation analysis shows HDAC10 interacts with HDAC3. HDAC10 localizes to the nucleus in GFP assays, and modulates transcription in luciferase reporter experiments.

CREB-H acts as a transactivator, as shown by lucerifase assay. Deletion of the putative transmembrane domain increased activation, suggesting that the transmembrane domain may be involved in modulating activity.

In the latter study, this repression was mediated by footprint II, an AT-rich element that functions as an inhibitory site of prolactin gene expression in nonpituitary cells and which was used to clone Cart-1.

HLF acts as a transcriptional activator in several cell types, as determined by CAT reporter gene assays.
